messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Chinese ideograms THN
messages.msgSnippet: On Mon, 20 May 2002 16:04:11 +0900 noemi hiraishi  ... Noemi, I m so glad you re back and posting.  I ve enjoyed your insights and
messages.messageBody:
On Mon, 20 May 2002 16:04:11 +0900 "noemi hiraishi" <noeminh@...>
writes:
> Deb, I am glad for Dylan! What a boy and what a family! Someday
> our children might meet and then...will they speak in English or
> in Japanese? Portuguese, who knows!
> .............

Noemi,
I'm so glad you're back and posting. I've enjoyed your insights and
observations so much!
Dylan is now picking up a few Korean words as well. His Karate club has
a visiting Tae Kwon Do instructor a few times a month, and in just this
short time, with no special effort, he's counting in Korean or Japanese,
responding to commands in the appropriate language and even painted a
poster for the club in Japanese. I don't know about Portuguese.... It
sounds intimidating! <G> All I can say is I'm glad you speak English so
well, because if we had to communicate using my Japanese, you'd never
know what I was talking about... These smart children will translate for
us, maybe.

Deb L
